Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: the bedroom
The western bedroom.

This is one of the mansion's private bedrooms. A couple of curtained windows provide good views of the back lawn, dark in the night. A canopy bed is placed against the middle of the south wall, and an ornate armoire against the northern half of the east wall. An armchair is standing in the northwest corner of the room.
http://www.skotos.net/MansionGame/images/BedroomWest.jpg
the eastern door
Set in the eastern wall is a panelled oak door. A brass knob is attached to the edge of the door.
the southern door
Near the western end of the southern wall is a panelled oak door. A brass knob and lock are attached to the edge of the door.
the ornate armoire

This is an ornate armoire set against the north half of the eastern wall, made from stained oak. Elegant carvings surround the doors, which can be locked. A silver mirror is mounted on each of the doors, reflecting .
A stained oak armoire, with elegant carvings around the doors and silver mirrors mounted on the lockable doors. It is set against the northern half of the eastern wall.
the armoire's elegant carvings
The elegant carvings depict a variety of frolicking animals, including weasels, badgers, and otters. An iconic sun sits at the center of the armoire, just above the doors.
The carvings depict a variety of frolicking animals under an iconic sun.
the armoire's mirrors
The armoire's mirrors shows in .
the canopy bed

This heavy canopy bed has little of its oak woodwork showing (except for the richly carved headboard) -- the copious green velvet upholstery covers most of the frame and posts. The canopy top is flat, with valences hanging down over the sides in heavy curves; a headcloth hangs down from the top frame, behind the headboard. A base valence covers the lower frame, supporting the mattress; 'bonegrace' curtains cover the posts, and long, draping curtains can close off the three 'open' sides. The bed is fully laid, with sheets, blanket, pillows and counterpane.
The bed is set with its head against the southern wall of the room.
A heavy, green-upholstered canopy bed, with its head set against the southern wall of the room. The bed is fully laid, with a mattress, sheets, blanket, pillows and counterpane.
the canopy bed's green velvet bonegraces
Green velvet bonegraces hang down from the canopy frame almost to the floor, covering the four posts supporting the frame.
Green cloth bonegraces hang down from the canopy frame almost to the floor, covering the four posts supporting the frame.
the canopy bed's green velvet canopy
A green velvet canopy is stretched across the top frame of the bed; the inner and outer valences conceal its edges.
A green velvet canopy is stretched across the top frame of the bed.
the canopy bed's green velvet curtains
Green velvet curtains hang down in heavy curves from the canopy frame, ready to conceal the three 'open' sides of the bed. The outer valence covers the top of the curtains.
Green cloth curtains hang down in heavy curves from the canopy frame, ready to conceal the three 'open' sides of the bed. The outer valence covers the top of the curtains.
the canopy bed's foot end
The low foot end of the canopy bed has no footboard.
The low, wide foot of the canopy bed.
the canopy bed's richly carved headboard

At the head end of the canopy bed is a tall, richly carved headboard. The carvings depict leaves, vines and other floral themes in a somewhat abstract form. Hanging behind the headboard is the green velvet headcloth. The head of the bed is pushed up against the southern wall of the room; on the bed, the bolster is placed against the head of the bed.
The richly-carved headboard of a canopy bed.
the canopy bed's green velvet headcloth
A green velvet headcloth, hanging down from the canopy frame behind the headboard. Dark embroidery, of abstract floral themes, covers much of the headcloth.
A green cloth headcloth, hanging down from the canopy frame behind the headboard.
the canopy bed's legs
The legs of this canopy bed are the carved bottom ends of the corner posts.
The legs of this canopy bed are the bottom ends of the corner posts.
the canopy bed's corner post
Four carved corner posts support the canopy of this bed; they are mostly hidden by green velvet bonegrace curtains wrapped around them.
The corner posts of this bed support the canopy; the posts themselves are mostly hidden by green bonegrace curtains.
the canopy bed's green velvet valences
Green velvet valences hang down from the canopy frame, covering it and the top of the bed curtains. A base valence covers the lower bed frame.
Green cloth valences hang down from the canopy frame, covering it and the top of the bed curtains. A base valence covers the lower bed frame.
the canopy bed's supporting frame
The canopy bed has a web of fresh rope strung across the frame of the bedstock, to support the mattress.
The canopy bed has a web mesh of fresh rope strung across its frame.
the tan wool blanket
This is large, square blanket, made from soft, tan wool. It is lying on the bed sheets, normally under the counterpane
A large, soft tan wool blanket on the bed.
the edge of a wool blanket
The four edges of the soft, tan blanket are each about eight feet long.
The four edges of the square wool blanket.
the wool blanket's center
The broad center of the soft, tan wool blanket.
The broad center of a tan wool blanket.
the white silk bolster
This is a seven foot long, pale white bolster, a tube made of smooth silk and filled with swansdown. It is placed on the bedsheets, against the head of the bed.
A white silk bolster, filled with down. It is placed at the head of the bed.
the end of a white bolster
The ends of the white, down-filled silk bolster are each about a foot across.
The two round ends of an white silk bolster.
white bolster's center
The broad center of the white silk bolster is soft and comfortable.
The center of a white silk bolster.
the green-upholstered armchair

This armchair is covered in holly-green woven fabric; only the beechwood legs are uncovered. The arms and back, built as a continuous piece wrapping around the seat, curve outwards and down slightly. It is set against the north wall, near its western end.
An armchair, upholstered in holly-green woven fabric; only the beechwood legs are uncovered. It is set against the north wall.
the green armchair's arm
Both arms of this holly-green upholstered armchair curve outwards and down towards the floor.
The green fabric upholstered arms of the armchair.
the back of the green armchair
The curved back of the holly-green armchair is cushioned with woven broadcloth.
The back of the green fabric-upholstered armchair.
the armchair's beechwood leg
The four beechwood legs of the green-upholstered armchair are square, and end in brass feet.
The legs of the fabric-covered armchair are made from beechwood.
the green armchair's seat
The seat cushion of the armchair is covered in woven holly-green broadcloth
The armchair's seat cushion is covered in green cloth.
the green velvet counterpane
This is large, square quilted counterpane, made from soft green velvet. It is lying atop the blanket and sheets of the canopy bed.
A large, square counterpane quilt, made from green velvet. It is on top of the blanket on the canopy bed.
the edge of a counterpane
The four edges of the soft, green velvet counterpane quilt are each about eight feet long.
The four edges of the square green counterpane.
the green counterpane's center
The broad center of the soft, green velvet counterpane quilt.
The broad center of a green velvet counterpane.
the north curtains
The heavy fabric of the curtains around the northern window are swept back by brass hold-backs.
the west curtains
The heavy fabric of the curtains around the western window are swept back by brass hold-backs.
the curtain holdbacks
The heavy fabric of the curtains around the windows are swept back by hold-backs: curved brass hooks mounted low on the edges of the windows.
the white down mattress
This is a fresh swansdown-filled mattress, lying on the bed; the cover is made of fresh white linen. It is normally covered by the sheets, blankets and counterpane.
A fresh, white down-filled mattress, lying in the bed.
the edge of a down mattress
The four edges of the white down mattress are each about seven feet long.
The four edges of the white down mattress.
the down mattresses's center
This is the center of a fresh, white down mattress; it is normally covered by the sheets, blankets and counterpane.
The center of a down mattress.
the edge of a white pillow
The four edges of the white, down-filled silk pillow are each about three feet long.
The four edges of an white silk pillow.
white silk pillow's center
The broad center of a white silk pillow is soft and comfortable.
The center of a white silk pillow.
the white silk pillows
There are two pale white bed pillows, each made of smooth silk and filled with swansdown.
A pair of white silk bed pillows, filled with down.
the white linen bedsheets

This are two bedsheets, made of fine bleached linen, about eight feet square. They are normally laid on the mattress, below the blanket and counterpane. A bolster is laid on them at the head of the bed.
White linen bedsheets.
the edge of a white bedsheet
The four edges of the two white linen bedsheets are each about eight feet long.
The edges of the white bedsheets.
the center of the white bedsheets
This is the center of a white linen bedsheet.
The center of the white linen bedsheets.
the view of the rear lawn
Through the windows, you can see:
Through the windows, you can see:
the east wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the east wall of the bedroom; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice. An oak-panelled door is set in this wall, near the southern end; an ornate armoire is set against the northern half of the wall.
the north wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the north wall of the bedroom; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall. A curtained window is set in the middle of this wall; past the clean, reflective glass you have a view of the dark back lawn. An armchair, upholstered in green fabric, is set against this wall, near the western end.
the south wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the south wall of the bedroom; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice. An oak panelled door is set in the western end of this wall; the head of a green canopy bed is pushed up against the middle of the wall.
the west wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the west wall of the bedroom; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice. A curtained window is set in the northern half, looking out onto the dark back lawn.
the curtained north window
A window is set in the middle of the north wall; white curtains are swept back from the window by brass hold-backs. The window provides a view of the lawn.
the curtained west window
A window is set in the west wall; white curtains are swept back from the window by brass hold-backs. The window provides a view of the lawn.

Notes:Category.Notes:Note: One of the two bedrooms of the mansion.
